bibl.title: Letter from Ida E. Kissinger to Jefferson Randolph Kean, August 4, 1941 [Enclosed in 06306012]

div1.p: Kissinger plans to nurse her husband at home and thanks Kean for the information about the veteran's hospital.

div1.head: Letter from Ida E. Kissinger to Jefferson Randolph Kean, August 4, 1941 [Enclosed in 06306012]
div1.opener:
Aug. 4/41.
Huntington, Ind. R 8,
J. R. Kean. Brig. Gen. Ret
Dear, Gen. Kean, Ret
div1.p:
Your letter in behalf of our
intrest was received and, I do
thank you. John R. Mr Kissinger
is on the mend. He is so he can
get around the House and Waits
on himself a great deal, and with
my assistance. I am shure we can
be together. For a while at least
he has had it mentioned. To him
several times that he go to a
Veterans home but he beg's so
for me not to send him and
I never will as long as its
in my power to take care of
him. We have been married 58
year's and never separated a month
and as long as I can care
for him on his annuity I
will do so. I may not be able
to carry the House hold Expenses
but am real good at it. For 12
years. I suported him and myself.
by washing so am a real good
manager;

When he returned from Cleveland
and had his stroke I was alone
and It was an awful shock
to me I have had a very severe
case of Shinglesand Sufferd
a lot from them but I have
a real good woman to help me.
So all I need to do in care
for my self and Mr. Kissinger
he has been a Kind Husband
and I will not put him in
a veterans Home as long as I
can care for him I am shure
you see my side of the case
he wants me with him all the
time but he is easy to Manage
and I hope he keeps so. I understand
these are possibilities of his
being a lot worse but if
he dosent get worse I shall keep-
him at Home.

I do thank you for your Intrest
and hope to hear from you
again.

In the past week he has been
so he can, talk a little and
I told him I heard from you
he seemed real pleased over it.

Again I thank you for
your Intrest.
